Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 8th overall pick, by California in 1966...
Injured on 5/15/1966 with a Tight Knee, out for one week...
Injured on 6/3/1966 with a Sprained Ankle, out for 4 days...
Injured on 4/11/1969 with a Tight Knee, out for one week...
Had first career hit (homerun) on 4/3/1971, off Bill Singer (BOS)...
Drove in 7 runs against Minnesota on 6/10/1971...
Drove in 6 runs against Cleveland on 6/16/1971...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Won Batter of the Month award on 9/1/1972, hitting .323 with 6 HR, 28 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/8/1975, hitting .393 with 5 HR, 11 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Oakland on 4/13/1977...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/14/1977, hitting .407 with 3 HR, 13 RBI...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 3/2/1980 to a 1-year deal worth $324,000 per year...
